p: PLA/α-pinene ( Figure 4d) and PLA/limonene electrospun fibres ( Figure 4d) showed surface features recalling those of PLA/BP-EO fibres ( Figure 1d), with well-defined and elongated pores uniformly distributed onto their surface. Here, the proposed mechanism of pore formation still includes phase separation events due to rapid evaporation of acetone and non-solubility of PLA in α-pinene and limonene. However, for those mats, the evaporation of the non-solvents transformed the polymer-lean regions in surface pores and significantly increased the concentration of polymer in the ejected filaments [ 37, 40]. The restrained mobility of the polymer chains in the polymer-lean phase prevented the pores from closure. In addition, the stretching of the polymer jet by the electric force caused the elongation of the nano-features.
